title: Atlanta Airport Limo and Other Travel-Stress Reducing Tips (Atl Shuttle)
text: By Atl Shuttle Sep 2, 2015 There is no doubt that traveling can be stressful. The planning, packing, and navigating your way through the airport and beyond takes it's toll on you. There are ways to alleviate the stress, including proper planning, packing the right items, and booking a limo service in Atlanta. Imagine being ready for delays, dealing with sick passengers nearby, poor nutrition, and the stress of getting to and from the airport. Follow these tips and your next trip, whether it's for business or pleasure, could go more smoothly and with less impact on your well-being.Before the TripProper planning is key to successful travel. If possible, book your hotel and flights far in advance. This not only ensures that you get the seat or type of room you want, but also that you have one less thing on your mind right before the departure date. If driving in traffic, navigating unfamiliar roads, or parking make you break out in a cold sweat, then book a limo service in Atlanta. That way you can sit back and enjoy the ride, possibly get some work done, or even catch a few z's if you're on an early departure.Packing and DressingMaking a list of what you need to pack is the best way to ensure nothing is forgotten. And we mean list everything. Check each item off as you go and there will be no panic moments where you realize there's no underwear in your bag, or that umbrella that would come in very handy when you land in a rainy locale isn't with you. Be sure your carry on contains medication and any other items you can't replace where your going if luggage is lost. You'll also want to tuck away some sanitizing items - which we'll explain in a moment.Dress for comfort. It's good to look nice, and dressing appropriately is important if you're heading straight to a business meeting when you arrive. But figure out the most effective way to dress comfortably. Perhaps you wear comfy shoes on the plane and change in the Atlanta Airport Limo when you arrive. Keep a light jacket, sweater, or blanket handy as airplanes and even airports can be chilly. Wear fabrics that have a bit of give, or stretch and that don't wrinkle easily. Stay HealthyConcerns about getting ill while traveling can promote stress which can lead to being more susceptible to illness. Airports, planes, bathrooms, hotels, and cabs are germ- infested places. While it may seem like overkill, you should pack hand sanitizer and disinfectant wipes in your carry on luggage and use them frequently. Everything from the door handle on the limo service in Atlanta that you took, to the sinks and counters in the airport bathroom, to the tray tables and arm rests on the plane there are surfaces covered in germs.Be diligent about cleaning your hands after touching surfaces that are touched by lots of people, including your checked luggage handle. Wipe down the tray table and arm rests on the plane with those sanitizing wipes. It's even wise to point the plane air vent in front of you, not down on your face.Pack healthy snacks and get plenty of sleep whenever you can.Following these tips to relieve travel stress will make your trips much more enjoyable and won't take such a toll on your body or your mind.
